item.title: The FastGig app has been released to connect flexible workers with job opportunities
item.description:
FastCo, the company known for its Asian non-executive job platform FastJobs, has launched FastGig, an app designed for the expanding gig economy. FastCo claims this is one of the first apps specifically for gig workers in Southeast Asia. FastGig, operating as Singapore’s first workforce-as-a-service (WaaS) platform, connects skilled flexible workers with companies facing staffing shortages, particularly during peak seasons. Julian Tan, FastCo’s Founder & CEO, highlights FastGig as a solution to a significant market gap, providing flexibility for both workers and businesses and transforming Singapore’s gig economy...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-fastgig-app-has-been-released-to-connect-flexible-workers-with-job-opportunities/

item.title: Intuit Singapore is set to release a popular expense management application
item.description:
Intuit, a leading provider of accounting software for small businesses worldwide, is getting ready to introduce QuickBooks Self-Employed in Singapore. This software helps users efficiently monitor their business expenditures. Launched in the US back in 2015, QuickBooks Self-Employed has gained significant traction, boasting a global customer base of 180,000, a considerable increase from 50,000 just a year ago, including users in Australia. The QuickBooks Self-Employed mobile app, expected to be released later this month, aims to support the expanding freelance workforce...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/intuit-singapore-is-set-to-release-a-popular-expense-management-application/
